org.spongepowered.api.entity

Class EntityInteractionTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.entity.EntityInteractionTypes

  • public final class EntityInteractionTypes
extends Object
    An list EntityInteractionTypes available in Vanilla.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static EntityInteractionType ATTACK
      Represents an interaction by "attacking", bound to left click in the client by default.
      static EntityInteractionType INDIRECT
      Represents an interaction that occurs indirectly by an Entity.
      static EntityInteractionType PICK_BLOCK
      Represents an interaction by middle clicking, bound to the scroll wheel in the client by default.
      static EntityInteractionType USE
      Represents an interaction by right clicking, bound to right click in the client by default.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • ATTACK

        public static final EntityInteractionType ATTACK
        Represents an interaction by "attacking", bound to left click in the client by default.

      • PICK_BLOCK

        public static final EntityInteractionType PICK_BLOCK
        Represents an interaction by middle clicking, bound to the scroll wheel in the client by default.

        This is only valid for BlockTypes, and has the effect of giving a player the picked block if in GameModes.CREATIVE.

      • USE

        public static final EntityInteractionType USE
        Represents an interaction by right clicking, bound to right click in the client by default.

      • INDIRECT

        public static final EntityInteractionType INDIRECT
        Represents an interaction that occurs indirectly by an Entity.

        A good example is an entity walking over a pressure plate and invoking an event. The interaction type in the event would be considered "indirect" as the entity wasn't directly interacting with the pressure plate.
